alert.note: Alert for Howell (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 7:51PM CDT until May 05 at 5:18PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell and Oregon. In southwest Missouri, Ozark. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 PM CDT, Emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Piney Creek at County Road 228, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420, Howell Creek at County Road 9790 and Bennetts River at Highway 142. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Thayer, Alton, Bakersfield, South Fork, Koshkonong, Brandsville and Thomasville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
